description.narrative: CRC, equity, gender-focused policies, strategies and government capacities are in place to identify socially and economically excluded children and support increased access to basic social services, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF, the Government and partners adopt improved practices for effectively planning, implementing and monitoring programmes and delivering quality, multi-sectoral and equity focused resuls

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF LABOUR AND SOCIAL AFFAI SOCIAL PROTECTION

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Technical assistance - Gender discriminatory roles and practices

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CRC, equity, gender-focused policies, strategies and government capacities are in place to identify socially and economicallyexcluded children and support increased access to basic social services

description.narrative: UNICEF support to the Office of the Prime Minister opened up strategic opportunities to support and facilitate the government, development partners, and UN work on social development during Somalia’s transition to a new National Development Plan, the HPIC decision point, and the COVID-19 pandemic. The new Mutual Accountability Framework 2019 commitments which includes the development of a National Action Plan for Children and additional funding for the emerging national social cash transfer programmeBaxnaanois a product of this relationship. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2021
